1948-1952
PR-196Collection processed by Jennifer Lewis (2002); migrated to ArchivesSpace by Joseph Ditta (2020)New-York Historical SocietyNew-York Historical Society170 Central Park WestNew York, NY 10024(212) 873-3400This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2020-07-16T17:48:59Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard The documents in the collection are in English.
New-York Historical Society
Lewis F. White photographs
White, Lewis F. (Lewis Felix), 1895-
PR-196
1 Linear feet (18 photographic prints : gelatin silver ; 9.5 x 5 in. or smaller, on mounts 11 x 14 in.)
1948-1952 Mid-20th century views of popular Manhattan tourist destinations, including Central Park, Rockefeller Center, and St. Patrick's Cathedral.
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers by appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Lewis F. White, 1953.
Arrangement
Photographs are grouped alphabetically by location and thereunder by subject. Titles are the photographer's, except for those in brackets, which were supplied by New-York Historical Society staff.
Biographical / Historical
Lewis F. White (1895–1967), a book designer, typographer, and photographer, was the founder and head of L. F. White Company, Inc., a small printing firm based in New York City.
Preferred Citation
This collection should be cited as: Lewis F. White Photographs, PR-196, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Processing Information
Collection inventoried by Jennifer Lewis, November 2002. WORD-document finding aid migrated to ArchivesSpace by Joseph Ditta, July 2020.
Scope and Contents
The Lewis F. White Photograph Collection spans the period from 1948 and 1952 and contains silver gelatin photographs taken in New York City. The photographs depict picturesque Manhattan sites and street life. Included are views of activity in Central Park, Rockefeller Center, a Greenwich Village art fair, and the Hudson River waterfront. Views of St. Patrick's Cathedral are also included. Each photograph is mounted, and each mount bears "Lewis F. White" in embossed type and has been captioned, signed and dated by the photographer.
Use Restrictions
Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to 20 exposures of stable, unbound material per day.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.
Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions
